title: Growing up
data:
**Growing up** is the process in which a monster turns into a larger version of itself (*e.g.,* a [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") turns into a [housecat](/wiki/Housecat "Housecat")). Monsters grow from killing monsters and gaining levels, from the effects of a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level"), or from [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith") [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Natural growth](#Natural_growth)
  - [1.1 Examples](#Examples)

- [2 Magical growth](#Magical_growth)

- [3 Changing form](#Changing_form)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Natural growth

If a monster kills another monster, its maximum and current [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") will both increase.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) If its maximum hp are increased above the *threshold* for its current level, it will gain a level. There is a limit to maxhp and levels a monster can gain in this way.

The monster will increase maxhp by d(victim level + 1), but no more than enough to bring it to the minimum for the next level. Current hp will increase by d(increase in maxhp) - 1.

The hp threshold for most monsters is 8 \* current level (4 for level 0). Exceptions are [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem") and [elementals](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") on their home plane.

The maximum level attainable via this method is 3/2 of the base level for the current monster type (or the next type if there is a more "grown up" form), but no less than 5 and normally no greater than 49.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Player monsters can reach level 30, and monsters which have a minimum level greater than 49 (i.e. [demon lords and princes](/wiki/Demon_lords_and_princes "Demon lords and princes")) have a maximum level of 50. If an increase in maxhp would increase the monster's level above this maximum, its maxhp are reset to the threshold for its current level.

### Examples

- *a [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") (currently level 4, maxhp 31) kills a [kobold shaman](/wiki/Kobold_shaman "Kobold shaman") (level 2). Its maxhp can increase by 1-3. If it gains 2-3 maxhp, it will become level 5, with maxhp of 33.*
- *a [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog") (currently level 9, maxhp 70) kills a [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king") (level 6) and would gain 4 maxhp. Its maxhp do not increase beyond 72.*

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"It would be nice to have a table on a separate page of each monster and its "natural" maximum level and hp"*

## Magical growth

A monster drinking a potion of gain level or eating a wraith corpse will gain a level and increase its current and maximum hp by d8.

Monsters may exceed their natural level limit in this way, although they may not exceed a hard limit of 49 (50 for named demons). Additionally, pets eating wraith corpses cannot exceed their base level by 15[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) (but engulfing live wraiths still works[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)). They may subsequently increase their maximum HP to the cap for their new level by killing monsters.

## Changing form

If a monster gains a level so that its current level equals or exceeds the minimum level of its next available form, it will "grow up" into that form (e.g. a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") which reaches level 4 will become a [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog").) If you can see or detect the monster, you will receive a message to that effect: "The [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") grows up into a [housecat](/wiki/Housecat "Housecat")" or "The [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") becomes a sergeant".

Growing up does not allow a monster to take a [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") form. If the new form is genocided, the monster dies and does not leave a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"). [Extinct](/wiki/Extinct "Extinct") forms are nonetheless allowed.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) This will generate the message "As [foo](/wiki/Foo "Foo") grows up into [foo](/wiki/Foo "Foo"), s/he \<expires/dies>!" if you can see or otherwise detect the monster.

Growing up is a one-way process, and [level draining](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") a grown-up monster will not cause it to revert to a lesser form. The only possible way for a monster to retake its previous form is [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") them, which yields no real benefit.

While many players may only ever notice the growth of [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") pets (dogs, cats, and horses), a surprising number of monsters can grow up in this manner. The possible form changes are as follows:[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

**Domestic animals:**

- [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") → [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") → [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog")
- [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") → [housecat](/wiki/Housecat "Housecat") → [large cat](/wiki/Large_cat "Large cat")
- [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony") → [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse") → [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse")

**Baby monsters:**

- [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") → [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")
- [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup") → [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound")
- [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub") → [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf")
- [baby gray dragon](/wiki/Baby_gray_dragon "Baby gray dragon") → [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon")
- [baby silver dragon](/wiki/Baby_silver_dragon "Baby silver dragon") → [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon")
- [baby shimmering dragon](/wiki/Baby_shimmering_dragon "Baby shimmering dragon") → [shimmering dragon](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon "Shimmering dragon") ([deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred"))
- [baby red dragon](/wiki/Baby_red_dragon "Baby red dragon") → [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon")
- [baby white dragon](/wiki/Baby_white_dragon "Baby white dragon") → [white dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon")
- [baby orange dragon](/wiki/Baby_orange_dragon "Baby orange dragon") → [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon")
- [baby black dragon](/wiki/Baby_black_dragon "Baby black dragon") → [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")
- [baby blue dragon](/wiki/Baby_blue_dragon "Baby blue dragon") → [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon")
- [baby green dragon](/wiki/Baby_green_dragon "Baby green dragon") → [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon")
- [baby yellow dragon](/wiki/Baby_yellow_dragon "Baby yellow dragon") → [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon")
- [baby gold dragon](/wiki/Baby_gold_dragon "Baby gold dragon") → [gold dragon](/wiki/Gold_dragon "Gold dragon") ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0"))
- [red naga hatchling](/wiki/Red_naga_hatchling "Red naga hatchling") → [red naga](/wiki/Red_naga "Red naga")
- [black naga hatchling](/wiki/Black_naga_hatchling "Black naga hatchling") → [black naga](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga")
- [golden naga hatchling](/wiki/Golden_naga_hatchling "Golden naga hatchling") → [golden naga](/wiki/Golden_naga "Golden naga")
- [guardian naga hatchling](/wiki/Guardian_naga_hatchling "Guardian naga hatchling") → [guardian naga](/wiki/Guardian_naga "Guardian naga")
- [baby long worm](/wiki/Baby_long_worm "Baby long worm") → [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm")
- [baby purple worm](/wiki/Baby_purple_worm "Baby purple worm") → [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm")
- [baby crocodile](/wiki/Baby_crocodile "Baby crocodile") → [crocodile](/wiki/Crocodile "Crocodile")

**Orcs and elves:**

- [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)") / [hill orc](/wiki/Hill_orc "Hill orc") / [Mordor orc](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") / [Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai") → [orc-captain](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain")
- [elf (monster)](/wiki/Elf_\(monster\) "Elf (monster)") / [Woodland-elf](/wiki/Woodland-elf "Woodland-elf") / [Green-elf](/wiki/Green-elf "Green-elf") / [Grey-elf](/wiki/Grey-elf "Grey-elf") → [elf-lord](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord") → [elvenking](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking")

**Other humanoids:**

- [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold") → [large kobold](/wiki/Large_kobold "Large kobold") → [kobold lord](/wiki/Kobold_lord "Kobold lord")
- [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)") → [gnome lord](/wiki/Gnome_lord "Gnome lord") → [gnome king](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king")
- [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster\) "Dwarf (monster)") → [dwarf lord](/wiki/Dwarf_lord "Dwarf lord") → [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king")
- [ogre](/wiki/Ogre "Ogre") → [ogre lord](/wiki/Ogre_lord "Ogre lord") → [ogre king](/wiki/Ogre_king "Ogre king")
- [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") → [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")

**Undead:**

- [lich](/wiki/Lich "Lich") → [demilich](/wiki/Demilich "Demilich") → [master lich](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich") → [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich")
- [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") → [vampire lord](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord")
- [manes](/wiki/Manes "Manes") → [lemure](/wiki/Lemure "Lemure")

**Giant animals:**

- [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") → [giant rat](/wiki/Giant_rat "Giant rat")
- [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider") → [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider")
- [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat") → [giant bat](/wiki/Giant_bat "Giant bat")

**Soldiers, Kops and watchmen:**

- [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") → [sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant") → [lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant") → [captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain")
- [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop") → [Kop Sergeant](/wiki/Kop_Sergeant "Kop Sergeant") → [Kop Lieutenant](/wiki/Kop_Lieutenant "Kop Lieutenant") → [Kop Kaptain](/wiki/Kop_Kaptain "Kop Kaptain")
- [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman") → [watch captain](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain")

**Quest guardians:**

- [student](/wiki/Student "Student") → [archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)")
- [attendant](/wiki/Attendant "Attendant") → [healer](/wiki/Healer_\(player_monster\) "Healer (player monster)")
- [page](/wiki/Page "Page") → [knight](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)")
- [acolyte](/wiki/Acolyte "Acolyte") → [priest](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)")
- [apprentice](/wiki/Apprentice "Apprentice") → [wizard](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)")

**Other:**

- [small mimic](/wiki/Small_mimic "Small mimic") → [large mimic](/wiki/Large_mimic "Large mimic") → [giant mimic](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic")
- [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") → [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest")

Although [queen bees](/wiki/Queen_bee "Queen bee") can lay [killer bee](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee") [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg"), and [winged gargoyles](/wiki/Winged_gargoyle "Winged gargoyle") can lay [gargoyle](/wiki/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") eggs, such offspring are sterile and will not grow into their parent forms.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

Several monsters added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") also are capable of growing up, and one monster has their growth path altered:

- [pile of killer coins](/wiki/Pile_of_killer_coins "Pile of killer coins") → [large pile of killer coins](/wiki/Large_pile_of_killer_coins "Large pile of killer coins") → [huge pile of killer coins](/wiki/Huge_pile_of_killer_coins "Huge pile of killer coins")
- [dingo puppy](/wiki/Dingo_puppy "Dingo puppy") → [dingo](/wiki/Dingo "Dingo") → [large dingo](/wiki/Large_dingo "Large dingo")
- [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva") → [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot") → [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
- [giant tick](/wiki/Giant_tick "Giant tick") → [giant flea](/wiki/Giant_flea "Giant flea") → [giant louse](/wiki/Giant_louse "Giant louse")
- [deep one](/wiki/Deep_one "Deep one") → [deeper one](/wiki/Deeper_one "Deeper one") → [deepest one](/wiki/Deepest_one "Deepest one")
- [lamb](/wiki/Lamb "Lamb") → [sheep](/wiki/Sheep "Sheep")
- [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)") → [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth")
- [gnoll](/wiki/Gnoll "Gnoll") → [gnoll warrior](/wiki/Gnoll_warrior "Gnoll warrior") → [gnoll chieftain](/wiki/Gnoll_chieftain "Gnoll chieftain")
- [migo drone](/wiki/Migo_drone "Migo drone") → [migo warrior](/wiki/Migo_warrior "Migo warrior")
- [vampire lord](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord") → [vampire mage](/wiki/Vampire_mage_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Vampire mage (SLASH'EM)")
- [baby shimmering dragon](/wiki/Baby_shimmering_dragon "Baby shimmering dragon") → [shimmering dragon](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon "Shimmering dragon")
- [baby deep dragon](/wiki/Baby_deep_dragon "Baby deep dragon") → [deep dragon](/wiki/Deep_dragon "Deep dragon")
- [gnome lord](/wiki/Gnome_lord "Gnome lord") → [gnome warrior](/wiki/Gnome_warrior "Gnome warrior")

### UnNetHack

- [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") → [giant rat](/wiki/Giant_rat "Giant rat") → [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat") → [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")

In the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch and some other [variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant") that include it, the giant rat grows up into the [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat") before it becomes the rodent of unusual size.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds new monsters that can grow up, and gives some monsters from vanilla the ability to grow up:[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

- [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") → [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") → [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog") → [guard dog](/wiki/Guard_dog "Guard dog")
- [winter wolf pup](/index.php?title=Winter_wolf_pup\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Winter wolf pup (page does not exist)") → [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub") → [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf")
- [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") → [housecat](/wiki/Housecat "Housecat") → [large cat](/wiki/Large_cat "Large cat") → [fat cat](/wiki/Fat_cat "Fat cat")
- [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") → [giant rat](/wiki/Giant_rat "Giant rat") → [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")
- [zoo bat](/index.php?title=Zoo_bat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zoo bat (page does not exist)") → [gaol bat](/index.php?title=Gaol_bat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gaol bat (page does not exist)")
- [baby violet dragon](/wiki/Baby_violet_dragon "Baby violet dragon") → [violet dragon](/wiki/Violet_dragon "Violet dragon")
- [crocodile](/wiki/Crocodile "Crocodile") → [killer croc](/index.php?title=Killer_croc\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Killer croc (page does not exist)")
- [ichneumon larva](/wiki/Ichneumon_larva "Ichneumon larva") → [giant ichneumon](/wiki/Giant_ichneumon "Giant ichneumon")
- [grid bug](/wiki/Grid_bug "Grid bug") → [spark bug](/wiki/Spark_bug "Spark bug") → [arc bug](/wiki/Arc_bug "Arc bug") → [lightning bug](/wiki/Lightning_bug "Lightning bug")
- [manes](/wiki/Manes "Manes") → [lemure](/wiki/Lemure "Lemure")
- [rock piercer](/wiki/Rock_piercer "Rock piercer") → [iron piercer](/wiki/Iron_piercer "Iron piercer") → [glass piercer](/wiki/Glass_piercer "Glass piercer") → [diamond piercer](/index.php?title=Diamond_piercer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Diamond piercer (page does not exist)")
- [dust vortex](/wiki/Dust_vortex "Dust vortex") → [dust devil](/index.php?title=Dust_devil\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dust devil (page does not exist)")
- [werewolf](/wiki/Werewolf "Werewolf") → [pack lord](/index.php?title=Pack_lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pack lord (page does not exist)")
- [deep one](/wiki/Deep_one "Deep one") → [deeper one](/wiki/Deeper_one "Deeper one") → [deepest one](/wiki/Deepest_one "Deepest one")
- [pig](/index.php?title=Pig\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pig (page does not exist)") → [feral hog](/index.php?title=Feral_hog\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Feral hog (page does not exist)")
- [ratman](/index.php?title=Ratman\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ratman (page does not exist)") → [ratman squeaker](/index.php?title=Ratman_squeaker\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ratman squeaker (page does not exist)")
- [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider") → [monstrous spider](/index.php?title=Monstrous_spider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Monstrous spider (page does not exist)")
- [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot") → [giant fly](/wiki/Giant_fly "Giant fly")
- [kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken") → [thing from below](/index.php?title=Thing_from_below\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Thing from below (page does not exist)")
- [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") → [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")
- [martial artist](/index.php?title=Martial_artist\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Martial artist (page does not exist)") → [grandmaster](/index.php?title=Grandmaster\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grandmaster (page does not exist)")
- [movanic deva](/wiki/Movanic_deva "Movanic deva") → [monadic deva](/wiki/Monadic_deva "Monadic deva") → [astral deva](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva")
- [shrieker](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker") → [screamer](/index.php?title=Screamer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Screamer (page does not exist)")
- [red mold](/wiki/Red_mold "Red mold") → [red moldier](/wiki/Red_moldier "Red moldier")
- [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold") → [yellow moldier](/wiki/Yellow_moldier "Yellow moldier")
- [green mold](/wiki/Green_mold "Green mold") → [green moldier](/wiki/Green_moldier "Green moldier")
- [brown mold](/wiki/Brown_mold "Brown mold") → [brown moldier](/wiki/Brown_moldier "Brown moldier")
- [ghoul](/wiki/Ghoul "Ghoul") → [ghast](/wiki/Ghast "Ghast")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [grow\_up](/wiki/Source:Makemon.c#grow_up "Source:Makemon.c") in [makemon.c](/wiki/Source:Makemon.c "Source:Makemon.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1700](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/makemon.c#L1700)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dogmove.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 336](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/dogmove.c#L336)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [meatobj](/wiki/Source:Mon.c#meatobj "Source:Mon.c") in [mon.c](/wiki/Source:Mon.c "Source:Mon.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1731](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/makemon.c#L1731)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [grownups data structure](/wiki/Source:Mondata.c#grownups_data_structure "Source:Mondata.c") in [mondata.c](/wiki/Source:Mondata.c "Source:Mondata.c")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/mondata.c#L1070>

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Growing up

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Growing up is the process in which a monster turns into a larger version of itself (e.g., a kitten turns into a housecat). Monsters grow from killing monsters and gaining levels, from the effects of a potion of gain level, or from wraith corpses.

Contents

  • 1 Natural growth
    • 1.1 Examples
  • 2 Magical growth
  • 3 Changing form
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 SpliceHack
  • 5 References

Natural growth

If a monster kills another monster, its maximum and current HP will both increase.[1] If its maximum hp are increased above the threshold for its current level, it will gain a level. There is a limit to maxhp and levels a monster can gain in this way.

The monster will increase maxhp by d(victim level + 1), but no more than enough to bring it to the minimum for the next level. Current hp will increase by d(increase in maxhp) - 1.

The hp threshold for most monsters is 8 * current level (4 for level 0). Exceptions are golems and elementals on their home plane.

The maximum level attainable via this method is 3/2 of the base level for the current monster type (or the next type if there is a more "grown up" form), but no less than 5 and normally no greater than 49.[2] Player monsters can reach level 30, and monsters which have a minimum level greater than 49 (i.e. demon lords and princes) have a maximum level of 50. If an increase in maxhp would increase the monster's level above this maximum, its maxhp are reset to the threshold for its current level.

Examples

  • a dog (currently level 4, maxhp 31) kills a kobold shaman (level 2). Its maxhp can increase by 1-3. If it gains 2-3 maxhp, it will become level 5, with maxhp of 33.
  • a large dog (currently level 9, maxhp 70) kills a dwarf king (level 6) and would gain 4 maxhp. Its maxhp do not increase beyond 72.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"It would be nice to have a table on a separate page of each monster and its "natural" maximum level and hp"

Magical growth

A monster drinking a potion of gain level or eating a wraith corpse will gain a level and increase its current and maximum hp by d8.

Monsters may exceed their natural level limit in this way, although they may not exceed a hard limit of 49 (50 for named demons). Additionally, pets eating wraith corpses cannot exceed their base level by 15[3] (but engulfing live wraiths still works[4]). They may subsequently increase their maximum HP to the cap for their new level by killing monsters.

Changing form

If a monster gains a level so that its current level equals or exceeds the minimum level of its next available form, it will "grow up" into that form (e.g. a little dog which reaches level 4 will become a dog.) If you can see or detect the monster, you will receive a message to that effect: "The kitten grows up into a housecat" or "The soldier becomes a sergeant".

Growing up does not allow a monster to take a genocided form. If the new form is genocided, the monster dies and does not leave a corpse. Extinct forms are nonetheless allowed.[5] This will generate the message "As foo grows up into foo, s/he <expires/dies>!" if you can see or otherwise detect the monster.

Growing up is a one-way process, and level draining a grown-up monster will not cause it to revert to a lesser form. The only possible way for a monster to retake its previous form is polymorphing them, which yields no real benefit.

While many players may only ever notice the growth of domestic pets (dogs, cats, and horses), a surprising number of monsters can grow up in this manner. The possible form changes are as follows:[6]

Domestic animals:

  • little dog → dog → large dog
  • kitten → housecat → large cat
  • pony → horse → warhorse

Baby monsters:

  • chickatrice → cockatrice
  • hell hound pup → hell hound
  • winter wolf cub → winter wolf
  • baby gray dragon → gray dragon
  • baby silver dragon → silver dragon
  • baby shimmering dragon → shimmering dragon (deferred)
  • baby red dragon → red dragon
  • baby white dragon → white dragon
  • baby orange dragon → orange dragon
  • baby black dragon → black dragon
  • baby blue dragon → blue dragon
  • baby green dragon → green dragon
  • baby yellow dragon → yellow dragon
  • baby gold dragon → gold dragon (NetHack 3.7.0)
  • red naga hatchling → red naga
  • black naga hatchling → black naga
  • golden naga hatchling → golden naga
  • guardian naga hatchling → guardian naga
  • baby long worm → long worm
  • baby purple worm → purple worm
  • baby crocodile → crocodile

Orcs and elves:

  • orc / hill orc / Mordor orc / Uruk-hai → orc-captain
  • elf (monster) / Woodland-elf / Green-elf / Grey-elf → elf-lord → elvenking

Other humanoids:

  • kobold → large kobold → kobold lord
  • gnome → gnome lord → gnome king
  • dwarf → dwarf lord → dwarf king
  • ogre → ogre lord → ogre king
  • mind flayer → master mind flayer

Undead:

  • lich → demilich → master lich → arch-lich
  • vampire → vampire lord
  • manes → lemure

Giant animals:

  • sewer rat → giant rat
  • cave spider → giant spider
  • bat → giant bat

Soldiers, Kops and watchmen:

  • soldier → sergeant → lieutenant → captain
  • Keystone Kop → Kop Sergeant → Kop Lieutenant → Kop Kaptain
  • watchman → watch captain

Quest guardians:

  • student → archeologist
  • attendant → healer
  • page → knight
  • acolyte → priest
  • apprentice → wizard

Other:

  • small mimic → large mimic → giant mimic
  • aligned priest → high priest

Although queen bees can lay killer bee eggs, and winged gargoyles can lay gargoyle eggs, such offspring are sterile and will not grow into their parent forms.

Variants

SLASH'EM

Several monsters added in SLASH'EM also are capable of growing up, and one monster has their growth path altered:

  • pile of killer coins → large pile of killer coins → huge pile of killer coins
  • dingo puppy → dingo → large dingo
  • larva → maggot → dung worm
  • giant tick → giant flea → giant louse
  • deep one → deeper one → deepest one
  • lamb → sheep
  • shoggoth → giant shoggoth
  • gnoll → gnoll warrior → gnoll chieftain
  • migo drone → migo warrior
  • vampire lord → vampire mage
  • baby shimmering dragon → shimmering dragon
  • baby deep dragon → deep dragon
  • gnome lord → gnome warrior

UnNetHack

  • sewer rat → giant rat → enormous rat → rodent of unusual size

In the Convict patch and some other variants that include it, the giant rat grows up into the enormous rat before it becomes the rodent of unusual size.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds new monsters that can grow up, and gives some monsters from vanilla the ability to grow up:[7]

  • little dog → dog → large dog → guard dog
  • winter wolf pup → winter wolf cub → winter wolf
  • kitten → housecat → large cat → fat cat
  • sewer rat → giant rat → rodent of unusual size
  • zoo bat → gaol bat
  • baby violet dragon → violet dragon
  • crocodile → killer croc
  • ichneumon larva → giant ichneumon
  • grid bug → spark bug → arc bug → lightning bug
  • manes → lemure
  • rock piercer → iron piercer → glass piercer → diamond piercer
  • dust vortex → dust devil
  • werewolf → pack lord
  • deep one → deeper one → deepest one
  • pig → feral hog
  • ratman → ratman squeaker
  • giant spider → monstrous spider
  • maggot → giant fly
  • kraken → thing from below
  • ghost → spectre
  • martial artist → grandmaster
  • movanic deva → monadic deva → astral deva
  • shrieker → screamer
  • red mold → red moldier
  • yellow mold → yellow moldier
  • green mold → green moldier
  • brown mold → brown moldier
  • ghoul → ghast

  1. ↑ grow_up in makemon.c

  4. ↑ meatobj in mon.c
  5. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1731
  6. ↑ grownups data structure in mondata.c
  7. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/mondata.c#L1070

rawPage: '''Growing up''' is the process in which a monster turns into a larger version of itself (''e.g.,'' a [[kitten]] turns into a [[housecat]]). Monsters grow from killing monsters and gaining levels, from the effects of a [[potion of gain level]], or from [[wraith]] [[corpse]]s. == Natural growth == If a monster kills another monster, its maximum and current [[HP]] will both increase.{{function|makemon.c|grow_up|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} If its maximum hp are increased above the ''threshold'' for its current level, it will gain a level. There is a limit to maxhp and levels a monster can gain in this way. The monster will increase maxhp by d(victim level + 1), but no more than enough to bring it to the minimum for the next level. Current hp will increase by d(increase in maxhp) - 1. The hp threshold for most monsters is 8 * current level (4 for level 0). Exceptions are [[golem]]s and [[elemental]]s on their home plane. The maximum level attainable via this method is 3/2 of the base level for the current monster type (or the next type if there is a more "grown up" form), but no less than 5 and normally no greater than 49.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1700|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} Player monsters can reach level 30, and monsters which have a minimum level greater than 49 (i.e. [[demon lords and princes]]) have a maximum level of 50. If an increase in maxhp would increase the monster's level above this maximum, its maxhp are reset to the threshold for its current level. === Examples === * ''a [[dog]] (currently level 4, maxhp 31) kills a [[kobold shaman]] (level 2). Its maxhp can increase by 1-3. If it gains 2-3 maxhp, it will become level 5, with maxhp of 33.'' * ''a [[large dog]] (currently level 9, maxhp 70) kills a [[dwarf king]] (level 6) and would gain 4 maxhp. Its maxhp do not increase beyond 72.'' {{todo|It would be nice to have a table on a separate page of each monster and its "natural" maximum level and hp}} == Magical growth == A monster drinking a potion of gain level or eating a wraith corpse will gain a level and increase its current and maximum hp by d8. Monsters may exceed their natural level limit in this way, although they may not exceed a hard limit of 49 (50 for named demons). Additionally, pets eating wraith corpses cannot exceed their base level by 15{{refsrc|src/dogmove.c|336|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} (but engulfing live wraiths still works{{function|mon.c|meatobj|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}). They may subsequently increase their maximum HP to the cap for their new level by killing monsters. ==Changing form== If a monster gains a level so that its current level equals or exceeds the minimum level of its next available form, it will "grow up" into that form (e.g. a [[little dog]] which reaches level 4 will become a [[dog]].) If you can see or detect the monster, you will receive a message to that effect: "The [[kitten]] grows up into a [[housecat]]" or "The [[soldier]] becomes a sergeant". Growing up does not allow a monster to take a [[genocide]]d form. If the new form is genocided, the monster dies and does not leave a [[corpse]]. [[Extinct]] forms are nonetheless allowed.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1731|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} This will generate the message "As [[foo]] grows up into [[foo]], s/he !" if you can see or otherwise detect the monster. Growing up is a one-way process, and [[level drain]]ing a grown-up monster will not cause it to revert to a lesser form. The only possible way for a monster to retake its previous form is [[polymorph]]ing them, which yields no real benefit. While many players may only ever notice the growth of [[domestic]] pets (dogs, cats, and horses), a surprising number of monsters can grow up in this manner. The possible form changes are as follows:{{function|mondata.c|grownups data structure|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} '''Domestic animals:''' * [[little dog]] → [[dog]] → [[large dog]] * [[kitten]] → [[housecat]] → [[large cat]] * [[pony]] → [[horse]] → [[warhorse]] '''Baby monsters:''' * [[chickatrice]] → [[cockatrice]] * [[hell hound pup]] → [[hell hound]] * [[winter wolf cub]] → [[winter wolf]] * [[baby gray dragon]] → [[gray dragon]] * [[baby silver dragon]] → [[silver dragon]] * [[baby shimmering dragon]] → [[shimmering dragon]] ([[deferred]]) * [[baby red dragon]] → [[red dragon]] * [[baby white dragon]] → [[white dragon]] * [[baby orange dragon]] → [[orange dragon]] * [[baby black dragon]] → [[black dragon]] * [[baby blue dragon]] → [[blue dragon]] * [[baby green dragon]] → [[green dragon]] * [[baby yellow dragon]] → [[yellow dragon]] * [[baby gold dragon]] → [[gold dragon]] ([[NetHack 3.7.0]]) * [[red naga hatchling]] → [[red naga]] * [[black naga hatchling]] → [[black naga]] * [[golden naga hatchling]] → [[golden naga]] * [[guardian naga hatchling]] → [[guardian naga]] * [[baby long worm]] → [[long worm]] * [[baby purple worm]] → [[purple worm]] * [[baby crocodile]] → [[crocodile]] '''Orcs and elves:''' * [[Orc (monster)|orc]] / [[hill orc]] / [[Mordor orc]] / [[Uruk-hai]] → [[orc-captain]] * [[elf (monster)]] / [[Woodland-elf]] / [[Green-elf]] / [[Grey-elf]] → [[elf-lord]] → [[elvenking]] '''Other humanoids:''' * [[kobold]] → [[large kobold]] → [[kobold lord]] * [[Gnome (monster)|gnome]] → [[gnome lord]] → [[gnome king]] * [[Dwarf '''Quest guardians:''' * [[student]] → [[Archeologist (player monster)|archeologist]] * [[attendant]] → [[Healer (player monster)|healer]] * [[page]] → [[Knight (player monster)|knight]] * [[acolyte]] Although [[queen bee]]s can lay [[killer bee]] [[egg]]s, and [[winged gargoyle]]s can lay [[gargoyle]] eggs, such offspring are sterile and will not grow into their parent forms. ==Variants==
